sentences.english: Iron sharpeneth iron, so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
sentences.chinese: 朋友互相砥砺，有如以铁锉铁。

definition: lit. to comb one's hair in the wind and wash it in the rain (idiom)/fig. to work in the open regardless of the weather
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
to search for sth/to seek/to quest/to explore
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to carry out (obligation) conscientiously/to behave sincerely
to take an oath to do sth/to pledge/to vow
to sharpen on grindstone/to improve oneself by practice
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
to lurk under water/to immerse oneself in (study etc)/to lie low/to keep a low profile/quiet/reserved/self-possessed
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
